alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 10 at 4:03PM PDT until July 10 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Chelan County in north central Washington... * Until 700 PM PDT. * At 403 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in 25 Mile Burn Scar south of Lake Chelan. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen west of the burn scar between the community of Plain and Lake Chelan. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are possible over the burn scar and other portions of the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams as well as steep terrain in and near the 25 Mile Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grouse Mountain Campground, Fox Creek Campground, Ramona Park Campground, Silver Falls Campground and 25 Mile Creek State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry creek beds is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
